text: What are some strategies for finding all the outcomes in a sample space when you have two or more events happening at the same time? How do you decide whether a game is fair or not?

Making organized lists and tree diagrams are examples of strategies for finding the sample space.

A game is fair if the outcomes are equally likely or if every player has an equal chance to win. For example, if the outcomes are not equally likely, points can be adjusted to give each player an equivalent chance.
